title: Owl
intro:
Owl is a reversing radar. It's a school project revolving around disability, specifically cerebro-injuries.

For this project, I worked with two designers: (Baptiste SINHSATTANAK) and (Clarisse GRÃ‰LY). We had to build an object or a game to help people with disabilities to socialize or to make their everyday life easier. After a few interviews with people from an association, we noticed that for those in electric wheelchairs, it was often difficult to make half-turns or to go backward without running into an obstacle, mainly because they couldn't turn their heads.

title: Monsieur Bouillon
intro: Monsieur Bouillon website was created for the Chevrier Group, a group of restaurants owned by Swiss chef Philippe Chevrier. The site includes weekly menus and the restaurant's various menus. There's also a page for reserving a table directly online. I worked on it during my first internship at Sowh4t.

title: Patio Restaurant
intro: Like Monsieur Bouillon, the Patio Restaurant website was made for one of chef Philippe Chevrier's establishments. The site also features the restaurant's menu, as well as a page allowing you to book a private room. I worked on it during my first internship at Sowh4t.

title: Avalanches Photoshoot
intro: The photoshoots for Les Avalanches follows the website refresh proposal. All pictures were taken during games and they also used some for their Instagram posts.

title: Bucketlist
intro: Bucketlist is an application created during the '100 days of SwiftUI'. It allows you to mark on the map places you've already visited/that you'd like to visit. You can change the title and description of a destination, and view nearby points of interest.

title: WeSplit
intro: WeSplit is a mobile application that makes it easy for multiple diners to split the bill. This application was created to prepare me for the third year of my bachelor's degree. It was part of the course I took to learn SwiftUI: 100 Days of SwiftUI.

title: Avalanches website
intro: Les Avalanches is a football team located in Annecy. After my first internship, I was looking for a new one. With this in mind, I contacted the local football team to bring some freshness to their website. This also led to other projects, including photoshoots with this same team.
